arm_group.description: Patients in this arm will receive only the education offered by the transplant center, as required by Medicaid. Upon completion of all data collection activities, patients in this arm will be offered the program.

Participants randomized to the intervention condition will attend a COACH session held in a small group format. The session provides information on living and deceased donor transplantation (i.e., the processes, risks and benefits) and on the key communication skills needed to effectively initiate and maintain conversations about transplantation.

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to test the impact of a newly developed educational program on
      kidney transplant candidates' communication about living and deceased donor kidney
      transplantation.

clinical_study.condition: End Stage Renal Disease and Kidney Transplantation

detailed_description.textblock:
The Communicating about Choices (COACH) in Transplantation program educates patients with
      end stage renal disease, who are waitlisted for kidney transplantation, about kidney disease
      and the risks, benefits and processes for both living and deceased donor transplantation.
      The program also teaches key communication skills needed to effectively initiate and manage
      conversations about transplantation.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Wait listed for kidney transplantation in active status

          -  Adult (at least 18 years of age)

          -  English speaking

          -  Capable of making medical decisions (i.e., not cognitively impaired)

          -  Non-institutionalized

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Not listed for kidney transplantation

primary_outcome.description: 2 self-report items: whether transplantation was discussed (yes/no) and the number of discussions held
primary_outcome.measure: Change in engagement in discussion of living and deceased donor transplantation
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (upon enrollment); 1 month post; 3 months post

primary_outcome.measure: Change in knowledge of living and deceased donor transplant
primary_outcome.time_frame: Upon enrollment (baseline); 1 month post; 2 months post

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in intentions to discuss living and deceased donor transplantation
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Upon enrollment (baseline); 1 month post; 3 months post

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Investigator), Primary Purpose: Health Services Research
